column4: https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/upstart-devel/2010-January/001168.html
Hi, i'm having that same issue
can someone help me with how to fix it?

anyone know how i can fix a race condition between the networking and dhcp3 server startup? It exists on the latest ubuntu. There is also someone who wrote about it in great lengths here: https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/upstart-devel/2010-January/001168.html
the problem is dhcp3 server needs my br0 bridge interface up before startup
latest = lucid or karmic?
the problem is bridge interface takes a while to come up after startup i believe.. so dhcp3 shouldn't start until then
understood - right now (without being good with upstart) I'd try to rename the dhcp3 script to something with a higher number (i.e. S99dhcp3) or so
!here | avi93
i tried that.. in fact i put '/etc/init.d/dhcp3-server restart' in my rc.local which is run last
i think bridge takes a while longer even after the rc scripts are done execution
found another set of people with same problem: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1326100
then I have to give up - sorry
hmm.. this might work for me.. gonna try it.. someone suggested some upstart hack in #10... http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1360974
looks promising :)
i added that script in upstart. do you knomw how the ordering works for upstart?
how do i know if the default dhcp3 server script and upstart wont collide?
sorry - no - just disable the original - see http://www.unixtutorial.org/2009/01/disable-service-startup-in-ubuntu/
ok thanks
np and Good luck :-)
